data.title: A must visit for a unque menu of beers
data.text: A favorite of mine for several years.  Too many types of beer etc to mention.  You just have to experience this establishment!

data.title: BEER BEER AND MORE BEER
data.text: This is the best place in Delaware County to drink beer. I believe that they have more than 300 beer choices.

data.title: Its Ok I Guess
data.text: This place has an overwhelming selection of beer.  So many it is hard to choose.  They do not have a very big selection of food.  The inside was very dark almost scary.   The deco was a bit on the strange side but very intriguing. And the bartender was not very attentive.  It was our first time going.  Hopefully next time will be better.

data.title: Excellent Non-Student Bar
data.text: The Heorot has plenty of space for anyone over the age of 22 to gather for a drink without dealing with grinding, vomiting, screaming undergrads. The atmosphere is great and the bar selection is excellent.

data.title: Drink before dinner
data.text: Decided to go for a drink before dinner.  Had a beer expert in the group so we went to Heorot.  They had many beers to chose from.  Sampled two different beers and nothing special but I am not a big beer drinker.  Contents of bar were very neat.

data.title: THE beer destination in Muncie
data.text: Heorot is a legend. OK, the original Heorot of Norse mythology is a legend too, but this house of many beers is catching up fast. There are always dozens of regional, national, and international beers on draft, and many more in bottles. The prices are reasonable, the friendly staff is helpful. Craft beer novices and aficionados will feel at ease. They also make their own beer (Wolfs Head) which is pretty good, though the competition is stiff. The selection of regional beer from Indiana, Michigan, and other surrounding states is excellent. It is a fun (occasionally hilarious) place to visit. Don't be intimidated by the decor, which is inspired by Beowulf (!) I'm a college professor, and I can attest that all types of beer drinkers are well represented. They have a limited selection of food, but it's mostly about the beer here. However, they also run an adjacent establishment (Valhalla) that has a full bar, wine selections, etc. This place is actually a destination for craft beer lovers throughout the region. If you are one of these and actually live in or around Muncie, you're crazy if you're not a regular.

data.title: What a selection.
data.text: If you consider yourself a beer nerd,  this place is a must.  About 70 taps and always changing.  My favorite place to stop and get a beer.

data.title: Great Atmosphere
data.text: Great place to get lost in the medieval aspect of the Heorot. It's adorned with everything from photos, beads and bras. Great taps and beers that change with seasons. The food is great; pizzas are always good with a great beer. 100-150 beers on tap with a great wine selection and sometimes MEAD!!! The owner is a great guy, usually hangs in the back with his mug of beer in hand. The german-style tables and booths are awesome. If you want to entertain yourself while there, grab some games from the game wall; listen to some good tunes with the jukebox and be merry with your pint!!

data.title: Great Place if you like Great Beer
data.text: Awesome selection of beer from all great brew houses.....the tap selection is extensive and very affordable.....truly a hidden gem for locals or travellers

data.title: Dirty bar.
data.text: It was dirtiest bar I have ever been in, old worn bra's hanging from the ceiling and off other decorations. Bar staff was rude and unkempt. Thankfull we only had one drink in there which came in a bottle, we stood outside to drink it as we were both disgusted by the state of the place.

data.title: Come here if you are serious about beer
data.text: The Heorot has an awesome variety of craft beers. The place is small and the beer is expensive, but if you are serious about beer this is the place to go. They have tons of beer on tap and hundreds in bottles. The inside is decorated with a Viking theme, which is amusing. The only drawback is the food. They will make a frozen pizza for you, but that is about it. I would definitely recommend eating somewhere else before you go. Otherwise the Heorot is awesome.

data.title: all the beer
data.text: My favorite bar in Muncie has to be the Heorat. I have come to sample so many different kinds of beer and such a huge selection it is. I have been to this bar about 8 times and enjoyed it each time except my last visit. I know that there is no way the staff can possible know all the beer on the menu but when I ask for a suggestion of what kind of stout beer to get don't hand me the menu and walk away that is so disrespectful.

data.title: Fun, Atmosphere and Friends!
data.text: The Heorat is a great bar for a fun time with friends!  It features imported beer and even has it's own craft brews.  This is one of those places where you'll always see a friend and if you don't it's a great place to make a friend!

data.title: WOW for beer lovers!
data.text: We stopped in here for drinks in the afternoon, and we were absolutely blown away by the incredible number of beers to choose from! There are so many rare and unusual beers that we have only heard about but have never seen.  I love the fact that you can have a 4 oz sample of any beer on tap for a nominal cost, so we had fun exploring some new beers!  Jason was the bartender and he was very friendly and helpful.  We WILL definitely return the next time we even drive close to Muncie!

data.title: BEST PUB IN THE MIDWEST
data.text:
One of the best beer pub I have ever visited. In fact, Beer Magazine rates it in the top 100 Midwestern bars/pubs. Hidden in downtown Muncie, Indiana near Dave Letterman's alley is this 
Viking styled pub boasting 300 different brands of beer and 50 or so on tap. If you drink one of every brand within a year, you name is inscribed on the Viking wall of fame. For those that need a break---they also have pizza. Age limit is 21 to whatever. Be sure to say hello in Viking: keaja to the Norse owner-Stan.

data.title: One of my favorite places for a beer - and I live in Colorado!
data.text:
I absolutely LOVE the Heorot (the spelling is wrong on Trip Advisor!) and wish I lived closer so I could visit it more frequently.  So many beers to choose from, knowledgeable staff, and cheap, delicious food!  Their garlic cheese bread is cheap, delicious, and hits the spot!

If you love beer you should DEFINITELY visit the Heorot!

data.title: So you enjoy beer?
data.text: Tired of the national chain beer selections?  Stop here.  This is the place for real people and real life.  Enjoy the local scene, choose an authentic beer, and slow down.  My kind of place.

data.title: Great Beer Bar
data.text: This pub is a place to go if you are an ale, beer and lager lover. Great for impressing dates, family and friends. I recommend coming after dinner for part 2 of a date. Great selection and atmosphere. Very Good!

data.title: Too cool for school
data.text:
The bartender didn't appreciate the fact that she had customers. Apparently we were interrupting her life the minute we walked in. Cold attitude, so we only stayed for one then left. Perhaps it's because I wasn't covered in tattoos, wearing a duck dynasty beard and I didn't have hula hoops stretched into my earlobes...
I guess the next time I want a great selection of beer ill just go to the local supermarket and save my money for a tattoo

data.title: Pricey
data.text: l suggest you be prepared to empty out your wallet when you dine there. I will never understand the resturants in downtown Muncie. I really don't see how they stay open with the prices they charge.
